text: Kenneth Lee Salazar (born March 2, 1955) is an American politician. He was the United States Ambassador to Mexico from September 14, 2021 until January 7, 2025 during the Joe Biden administration. Salazar was a member of the United States Senate from Colorado from 2005 until being appointed as the United States Secretary of the Interior in 2008 by President Barack Obama. Salazar officially became secretary in 2009. He resigned as secretary in 2013. Salazar is a Democrat. Before being elected to the U.S. Senate, Salazar was the Colorado Attorney General from 1999 until 2005. In May 2021, President Joe Biden nominated Salazar as the Ambassador to Mexico. His nomination was confirmed by the United States Senate on August 11, 2021. Salazar was born in Alamosa, Colorado. He studied at Colorado College and at the University of Michigan. ==References== Category:1955 births Category:Living people Category:United States Secretaries of the Interior Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians Category:United States senators from Colorado Category:Ambassadors of the United States to Mexico Category:Lawyers from Colorado
